description: The panel depicts two men and a dog stranded in a boat on choppy water. One man informs the other, identified as Larry, that he lost a straw draw to determine who would be eaten due to a lack of food. The phrase "fair is fair" is used ironically to justify this life-or-death decision. The scene presents a darkly comedic situation where survival instincts lead to a lottery for cannibalism. The presence of the dog adds a layer of absurdity to the grim predicament.
caption: “Fair is fair, Larry. … We’re out of food, we drew straws—you lost.”
